result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Dewaine Pouliot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan Dewaine Pouliot is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan Dewaine Pouliot was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of the Plea/sentencing hearing held on September 26, 2022

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
10:10 AM Defendant Ryan Dewaine Pouliot in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Ryan Dewaine Pouliot.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement. Defendant will plead to count 1, all other counts will be dismissed. 4 year prison sentence fashioned as 2 years IC and 2 years ES. Sentence will run concurrent to any other sentence, specifically 19CF554. Conditions of $50 fine plus costs. 0 days sentence credit. 
Defendant pleads no contest to count 1. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's pleas and the finds that the pleas have been freely and intelligently made. Defendant is found guilty on count 1. Count 2, 3, and 4 are dismissed.
Court orders on count 1, 4 year prison sentence fashioned as 2 years IC and 2 years ES. Sentence will run consecutive to any other sentence, specifically 19CF554. 0 days sentence credit.  Conditions of Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC and $50 fine plus costs. Eligible for both programs.

9:31 AM Defendant Ryan Dewaine Pouliot in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Ryan Dewaine Pouliot.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes close to resolution and asks for plea/sentencing date. Attorney Rosenthal in agreement. Court sets plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:38 AM Defendant Ryan Dewaine Pouliot in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Ryan Dewaine Pouliot.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal asks for another status. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:38 AM Defendant Ryan Dewaine Pouliot in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Ryan Dewaine Pouliot.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Court review minutes from last meeting. Rosenthal indicates revocation hearing in 2019 file has been rescheduled. Asks for status after revocation hearing.
Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Ryan Dewaine Pouliot in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Ryan Dewaine Pouliot.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Requests a status conference. There is a revocation hearing set. Court sets status conference.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Ryan Dewaine Pouliot in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Ryan Dewaine Pouliot.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:52 PM
Ryan Pouliot appears in custody via zoom. Peter Kruger appears in person for the State of WI. 

 Atty Hoffman states Dfd called their office yesterday and they haven't connected. Court indicates preliminary set for tomorrow. Dfd spoke with PD office and was advised to waive time and reset prelim, haven't had time to complete paperwork yet. Court accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntary. State does not object to adjournment.  Court will remove tomorrow's hearing and will set prelim 5/18 @ 10:30. Atty Hoffman if no conflict and as long as he calls and completes paperwork today.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No use or possession of firearm or ammunition.

1:54 PM Defendant Ryan Dewaine Pouliot appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified as correct.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant asks for special appearance by Attorney Hoffman.  Waives reading, pleads not guilty, asks for preliminary on felony count. Court accepts plea.
State requests $1500 cash, no use or possession of drugs, no use or possession of firearms or ammunition. Cites priors and prior FTA's. Currently on supervision hold. 
Hoffman questions defendant. Lifelong superior resident. Could post around $750.
Court orders $1500 cash, with conditions of no use or possession of drugs, no use or possession of firearms or ammunition.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
